website_summaries.verdict: Provides a good value, as it will cover more fully than spray paint, while giving you a good performance level.
pros: Texture of this engine enamel paint will give you an excellent coverage, as you won't have to go back over areas like you have to do sometimes with spray paint
Will give you an excellent long-lasting paint coverage that you'll appreciate
cons: Some people greatly prefer the ease of application with spray paint over this product

customer_reviews.title: Usually the main ingredient of Snapple (Best stuff on earth)
customer_reviews.text: Ive always had great results with POR15, the can of white engine enamel I got today however did not seem like POR15. Very watery even after repeated stirs scraping the bottom. Tried to use it, but since it wasn't going on like it should (and cured POR15 is near indestructable) I've already slathered it with aircraft stripper. Guessing it was old product, but the can looked new, not like it was sitting on a shelf for years. 5 stars for past experience, but 0 stars for this can. Bad math means I give it a 4 star. POR15 is amazing, might get a new can elsewhere - or just forget about it all together.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Levels well even when brushed on
customer_reviews.text: I guess time will tell, but so far the '75 GoldWing block (aluminum) that I am painting is looking great. I've spent several weeks cleaning the block to get caked-on oil, grease, and road grime off of it. Finally scrubbing with carb cleaner, then Scrubbing Bubbles, and finishing with isopropyl alcohol. The color is exactly what I wanted, and even though brushed on the paint levels very nicely. Time will tell for durability. Update: over a year later and still looking great and winning trophys! Had two small chips from handling that touched-up perfectly. MG Maroon engine in dark emerald green metalic bike works well.
customer_reviews.author: N. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Chevy Orange ???
customer_reviews.text: The color swatch on the advertisement and on the can appears more Red than Chevy Orange however the paint is quite orange. As a matter of fact probably more orange than the VHT version of "Chevy Orange". ( Not a great match since the VHT is more Red ). Paint flows out nicely on the block and dries to a durable glossy finish. Getting a similarly acceptable finish on the oil pan was a bit more challenging. A wet finish caused some runs and a dry finish left some brush marks. Overall I think this will work well on the block and seems tough enough to last a while.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Perfect color.  Great finish!
customer_reviews.text: Restoring my MGB. Paint was perfect match for the engine. Brushed it on and it finished out like a full scale spray job. Could not have asked for better. More than enough paint to do two engines. I did clean the engine well, primed it with duplicolor etching primer. Great adhesion and great coverage. POR 15 also offers a great prep chemical but I had already primed the engine prior to my decision to use this product. Technical support said the etching primer would be just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great engine paint!
customer_reviews.text: This brushed on beautifully and was a great match for the original color. I put on two coats with a foam brush, and it dried smooth and free of brush marks. I was initially concerned that a pint would be too small, but it was more than plenty for me to paint the whole block, heads, and oil pan. I think it looks way better than I could have gotten with a spray can, and if it holds up like the rust sealer stuff they sell, it is going to look good for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Whitesel

customer_reviews.title: It was unfortunate that everything did not work out on this transaction.
customer_reviews.text: The product was to be Chevy orange but was a lighter color orange.It did not match the orange on either of my 2 Chevy engines. So it cost me 11 dollars to return unused. I am glad TCF Global said they would take it back. I suppose on something like this one should try and buy local. It was not their fault. It is a show car so everything needs to look stock.
customer_reviews.author: Ron McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Super Product!
customer_reviews.text: Needed to touch up a few large spots on the intake manifold of my 327 chevy engine. Color matched perfectly and flowed nicely onto surface. Used a foam brush for the large sports and a small artist brush for small spots. Went on easily and looks great. Product arrived quickly and no damage to can. I did no prep other than cleaning the surface.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa F. Fanney

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because I couldnt find rustoleum high heat in white that wasn't in a spray can. This stuff is runny and really sticky. I'll never buy it again, but it was worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: I have a 1959 corvette that has been restored to look like new. Some of the engine paint was chipped or scratched during installation. A foam brush and little dab of engine paint restored the engine to show condition.
customer_reviews.author: maddog

customer_reviews.title: Good paint
customer_reviews.text: I like this paint. A strong consistency that seems to discourage drops and covers well. It is a perfect color match for Caterpillar's Matterhorn White. I just bought a second can.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Really great results
customer_reviews.text: Worked fantastic! Small 3/4" brush and leveled out. Didn't have to pull engine and no over spray Highly recommended! Been on for a few months now. Stills looks great. No flaking or peeling at all
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: white paint turned yellowish brown after a month
customer_reviews.text: i painted two 700 hp diesel engines in my boat and this product failed to stay bright white. it turned a yellowish brown color instead of bright white. a lot of money was spent prepping the engines and then painting them to look like new engines. it was a mistake to try and freshen up the motors, waste of time and money. i requested a response and have not heard from anyone.
customer_reviews.author: larry

customer_reviews.title: amazing color
customer_reviews.text: okay, this color is AMAZING. I put a powered pearl in it and it mixed beautifully. I have tons left over. Great paint.
customer_reviews.author: Catalina

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great. Good prep work, and you can put down a paint that lasts very well
customer_reviews.author: Steve Astro

customer_reviews.title: Awesome paint
customer_reviews.text: Love this!! Used to paint a 350 and could not be more happy with this paint
customer_reviews.author: Chris brant

customer_reviews.title: Works great.  Good value
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Good value I love this stuff. I restore classic cars and POR 15 is the best for color match and durability.
customer_reviews.author: Lester Aseere

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: I used it to paint my wood stove looks great so far
customer_reviews.author: Carolin zheng

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, great color match looks like what was already there, great for touch up
customer_reviews.author: arthur r briggs

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Ever since i used my first can of por-15 Ive been a huge fan and to find out you can get engine enamel and flat black well ni was hooked!
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: exactly what I wanted matched what was on the motor now
customer_reviews.author: jim h

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Bought this paint to use on an LS6 I was putting in my car and wanted it to pop in the engine bay. I took my time and brushed it in and in some areas it did take 2 coats. But it turned out better than I had hoped
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth krawiec

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great on the old Ford Diesel in my Trawler
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Needed smaller amount for touchup. Had to but whole quart.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly S. Haile

customer_reviews.title: Do not apply when hot outside
customer_reviews.text: I really like the orange color it's nice bright and shiny and easy application
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: worst paint I ever used. Love the other paints they make
customer_reviews.author: awlgripmech

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Not good at all in any way quality is horrible! Do not buy this !!!
customer_reviews.author: Dorajumilla

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT USE THIS
customer_reviews.text: Terrible paint. Do not buy. I wanted a solid, durable finish so I "invested" in this paint. Having used POR 15 on brake calipers with a cheap brush yielding awesome results I expected similar result with this product. Either I had a bad batch or this is a bad formula. Three days, three coats. Horrible in every way imaginable. I've shot many engines after a quick degrease with KMart rattle can with better results. More prep in this effort than all others combined so that's not the issue. Thanks POR.
customer_reviews.author: M.C.

customer_reviews.title: Not even close to what it should be
customer_reviews.text: I spent a LOT of time on my engine - prepared it just as directions noted - The paint went on terribly - It was way too bright (almost fluorescent) and did not come close to matching the original color on the engine - also - the next day the paint was still very gummy and did not adhere evenly - VERY unhappy - waste of money - I started over and removed all paint that I applied - I will use a different product next time - The POR degreaser also was ineffective!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: POR-15 42228 Olds Gold Engine Enamel - 1 pint
product_meta.description:
Color:Olds Gold| Size:1 pintEngine Enamel 

Oldsmobile Gold 1 Pint
feature_bullets: Extra-pigment ENGINE ENAMELS have been formulated by POR-15 to be the best and most beautiful engine enamels you can buy.
Typically, a pint is enough for an entire engine.
Enamels are available in incredibly rich colors that flow easily, cover better than any other paint, and last longer.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars102 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
